author: Special Correspondent
text:
Corporation to build 240 shops on 4.86 acres in three phases

Work in progress on the fruit market near Mattuthavani bus stand in Madurai.— Photo: S. James

There is some good news for road users in the city as the wholesale and retail fruit markets in Simakkal, Yanaikal and East Marret Street will be shifted to a spacious complex near Mattuthavani integrated bus stand within a month.

The Corporation of Madurai held several rounds of talks with the office-bearers of fruit vendors’ associations and arrived at a consensus a year ago. Based on the memorandum of understanding, the corporation would provide land, construct building (shops) and ensure basic amenities such as underground drainage, drinking water, storm water drain facilities.

As per the arrangement, the corporation will build 240 shops on 4.86 acres in three phases at a cost of Rs.16 crore. For their part, the fruit vendors will contribute Rs.11 crore towards the project.

Corporation officials said that shifting of the fruit market from the existing locations in and around Sri Meenakshi Sundareswarar Temple would ease traffic congestion in the city.

On Tuesday, Mayor V.V. Rajan Chellappa, Corporation Commissioner C. Kathiravan and senior officers visited the site and inspected the work in progress.

In all probabilities, the new fruit market complex would become functional in about a month, officials said.
title: New fruit market to move to Mattuthavani within a month
